title: Aveda -form typeface
content:
Hello,  
I'm interested to know if anyone cal help me identify this typeface.  
It is from a form used in Aveda Concept Spas.  
Thanks so much!  
Jenna

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [formsample.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150311183614/http:/typophile.com/files/formsample.png) | 62.19 KB |
author: artistjenna

comments.content: Do you know of a font that may be similar without the hefty pricetag?

No. Not a semi-slab like that.  
 [Caecilia](http://web.archive.org/web/20150311183614/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/Caecilia/fonts/) would be a pure slab alternative.
How many weights/styles do you need? [TheMix Basic Plain](http://web.archive.org/web/20150311183614/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/lucasfonts/themix_basic_plain/) can be had for $50.

Here’s a very nice humanist slab for those with a small budget: [Silica](http://web.archive.org/web/20150311183614/http:/www.stonetypefoundry.com/silicasemiboldsp.html), 6 weights for $49. Yet no OpenType format and no Italics, though.
